alert.note: Alert for Price; Sawyer (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 31 at 3:08PM CDT until April 01 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations in Price County of 7 to 12 inches and Sawyer County of 4 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Sawyer and Price Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 7 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds and the heavy snowfall could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates of one inch per hour are expected in eastern Sawyer County late tonight. Higher snowfall rates up to two inches per hour are possible in central and southern Price County late tonight as well.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
